revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=R6900 |revision=v1 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |fcc_date=10/05/2015 |fcc_id=PY313200233 |ic_id=4054A-13200233 |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4709A0;BCM4709A0KFEBG, TT1308 P10, E9MCJ-01 Z1C; |cpu1_cspeed=1.0 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 MiB |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D |ram1=256 MiB |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B2G1646E-BCK0 |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, 3.3V TTL |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1312 P20, 273016 3 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2623L;SKY, 2623L, 322BD;3;,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 243BE, 1243 MY;3; |stock_boot=CFE |stock_os=Linux |tp_firmware=FreshTomato |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_user=admin |default_pass=password }} {{TagLine|Nighthawk AC1900 Smart WiFi Router}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.netgear.com/home/products/networking/wifi-routers/R6900.aspx}}{{SupportPage|vendor=Netgear|model=R6900}} Most of the information on this page was copied from the [[Netgear R7000]] since the FCC ID is the same.
This router appears to be a stripped down R7000 [[List of Costco Exclusive Wireless Devices|exclusively for Costco]] like the [[Netgear AC1450]] was.
The only obvious change from the R7000 to this R6900 appears to be the removal of the USB 2.0 port. The R6900 was mentioned in the [https://fccid.io/document.php?id=2772870 Test Report (NII).pdf] dated 10/05/2015. *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=268918 On '''DD-WRT''' forum thread] __NOTOC__
